docs.lead_paragraph: Four years ago, seven big-money donors and leading Republican activists from Iowa loaded into a private plane and headed to New Jersey for an urgent meeting with Chris Christie. Their message: Run, Chris, run.

docs.lead_paragraph: Striking FairPoint workers gave their union negotiators a standing ovation Friday at the first briefings and ratification votes on a tentative agreement aimed at ending a four-month strike.

headline.main: Unions Begin 3 Days of Voting on FairPoint Contract
headline.print_headline: Unions Begin 3 Days of Voting on FairPoint Contract

docs.snippet: Striking FairPoint workers gave their union negotiators a standing ovation Friday at the first briefings and ratification votes on a tentative agreement aimed at ending a four-month strike.

docs.lead_paragraph: As any ambitious Republican must do, the early contenders in the presidential race are courting the charlatan caucus.
docs.abstract: Paul Krugman Op-Ed column warns that Republican 'charlatan caucus,' whose members view world through ideological lens and adhere to faulty supply-side economics, continue to wield considerable influence over their party despite their consistent inaccuracy; scores rising presidential contender Scott Walker for pledging allegiance to this caucus by participating in event hosted by prominent supply-siders.
docs.snippet: As any ambitious Republican must do, the early contenders in the presidential race are courting the charlatan caucus.

docs.lead_paragraph: Republicans are attempting a manipulation of the legal system that would make a mockery of all that conservative legal scholars profess to believe.

headline.main: The Plot to Kill Health Care
headline.print_headline: The Plot to Kill Health Care

docs.abstract: Timothy Egan Op-Ed column scores Republican attempt to undermine Affordable Care Act in Supreme Court case King vs Burwell; holds move represents brazen manipulation of legal system; excoriates challengers for attempt to deprive millions of Americans of health insurance based on technical reading of law's language.
docs.snippet: Republicans are attempting a manipulation of the legal system that would make a mockery of all that conservative legal scholars profess to believe.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: Wall Street is in a transformation, as bonuses shrink, revenue growth stalls and business lines are cut, driven primarily by regulatory efforts.

headline.main: New Rules Spur a Humbling Overhaul of Wall St. Banks
headline.print_headline: On Wall St., Rules on Capital Humble Banks and Shrink Pay

docs.abstract: Regulatory push has caused contraction on Wall Street, where bonuses have shrunken, growth has stalled and business lines have been cut; changes are largely due to strictures requiring banks to hold far more of their capital in reserve, though economic trends and other regulations have also been factor; profits have remained high despite changes, though they are increasingly dependent on cost cutting.
docs.snippet: Wall Street is in a transformation, as bonuses shrink, revenue growth stalls and business lines are cut, driven primarily by regulatory efforts.

keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: Missouri Secretary of State Jason Kander launched a Democratic challenge Thursday to U.S. Sen. Roy Blunt, criticizing the Republican's long political career and asserting that "it's time for a new generation of leaders" in Washington.

headline.main: Democrat Kander to Challenge GOP US Sen. Blunt in Missouri

docs.lead_paragraph: Wherever you think he may rank as a president, there is no doubt that the time of his presidency will be remembered as transformational.

docs.lead_paragraph: The fines for not signing up for health insurance in 2014 under the Affordable Care Act are coming due at tax time. The fines for 2015 will be worse.
docs.abstract: Editorial urges Obama administration to extend enrollment period for federal health insurance exchanges from Feb 15 to beyond April 15, when fines for not doing so must be paid; outlines benefits of extension, including saving money for those simply uninformed, and increasing number of enrollees; suggests states offering their own exchanges follow example of Washington, which has extended its residents enrollment period.
docs.snippet: The fines for not signing up for health insurance in 2014 under the Affordable Care Act are coming due at tax time. The fines for 2015 will be worse.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: The Obama administration reported an increase in registrations for the federal health care exchange, and said many people would suffer if the Supreme Court blocked premium subsidies.

headline.main: As Health Exchange Sign-Ups Rise, So Do Stakes for Supreme Court
headline.print_headline: As Health Exchange Sign-Ups Rise, So Do Stakes for Court

docs.abstract: Obama administration says 8.6 million people in 37 states have selected or renewed health plans through federal health insurance marketplace; Health and Human Services Sec Sylvia Mathews Burwell says it was not Congressional intent to deny premium subsidies, in form of tax credits, to Americans living in states that did not set up exchanges; comment may be message to Supreme Court, scheduled to hear case challenging subsidies in those states that use federal exchange.
docs.snippet: The Obama administration reported an increase in registrations for the federal health care exchange, and said many people would suffer if the Supreme Court blocked premium subsidies.

keywords.name: subject
